required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study of MM-121 in Combination With Multiple Anticancer Therapies in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Pharmacologic and Pharmacodynamic Study of MM-121 in Combination With Multiple Anticancer Therapies in Patients With Advanced Solid Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the safety and tolerability of escalating doses of MM-121 + certain anticancer therapies

detailed_description.textblock: This study was a Phase 1 and pharmacologic dose-escalation trial of MM-121 in combination with certain anticancer therapies. The dose-escalation portion of the study employed a 3 + 3 design to assess the safety, tolerability, and pharmacokinetics of MM-121 administered weekly in combination with certain anticancer therapies in patients with advanced/recurrent cancer. Doses of MM-121 and/or the anticancer therapy were escalated until either the MTD is identified or the combination was shown to be tolerable at the highest planned doses.

primary_outcome.measure: To Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Escalating Doses of the MM-121 Anticancer Therapies
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 88.1 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability data presented in detail in the adverse events and serious adverse events section of the results posting

primary_outcome.measure: To Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of MM-121 in Combination With Anticancer Therapies: MM-121 Doses
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 88.1 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose of each therapy combination was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was considered the Recommended Phase 2 Dose. Dose Levels (3 week cycles) MM-121 doses tested: 20 mg/kg IV one-time loading dose then 12 mg/kg IV QW (20/12 mg/kg); 40/20 mg/kg Gemcitabine doses tested: 1000 mg/m2 Day 1 and 8 Pemetrexed doses tested: 500 mg/m2 Day 1 Carboplatin doses tested: 5 or 6 AUC Day 1 Cabazitaxel doses tested: 20 or 25 mg/m2 Day 1 of 3

primary_outcome.measure: To Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of MM-121 in Combination With Anticancer Therapies: Gemcitabine
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 88.1 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose of each therapy combination was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was considered the Recommended Phase 2 Dose. Dose Levels (3 week cycles) MM-121 doses tested: 20 mg/kg IV one-time loading dose then 12 mg/kg IV QW (20/12 mg/kg); 40/20 mg/kg Gemcitabine doses tested: 1000 mg/m2 Day 1 and 8

primary_outcome.measure: To Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of MM-121 in Combination With Anticancer Therapies: Carboplatin
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 88.1 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Maximum Tolerated Dose reported in Target AUC, as calculated by the Calvert Formula Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose of each therapy combination was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was considered the Recommended Phase 2 Dose. Dose Levels (3 week cycles) MM-121 doses tested: 20 mg/kg IV one-time loading dose then 12 mg/kg IV QW (20/12 mg/kg); 40/20 mg/kg Carboplatin doses tested: 5 or 6 AUC Day 1

primary_outcome.measure: To Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of MM-121 in Combination With Anticancer Therapies: Pemetrexed
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 88.1 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose of each therapy combination was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was considered the Recommended Phase 2 Dose. Dose Levels (3 week cycles) MM-121 doses tested: 20 mg/kg IV one-time loading dose then 12 mg/kg IV QW (20/12 mg/kg); 40/20 mg/kg Pemetrexed doses tested: 500 mg/m2 Day 1

primary_outcome.measure: To Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of MM-121 in Combination With Anticancer Therapies: Cabazitaxel
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 88.1 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose of each therapy combination was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was considered the Recommended Phase 2 Dose. Dose Levels (3 week cycles) MM-121 doses tested: 20 mg/kg IV one-time loading dose then 12 mg/kg IV QW (20/12 mg/kg); 40/20 mg/kg Cabazitaxel doses tested: 20 or 25 mg/m2 Day 1 of 3

primary_outcome.measure: To Characterize Dose-limiting Toxicities (DLTs) Associated With the Combination of MM-121 With Anticancer Therapies
primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 88.1 weeks
primary_outcome.description: To establish the safety of escalating doses of MM-121 administered in combination with multiple anti-cancer therapies in order to determine the recommended phase 2 dose. Dose-escalation conducted using standard 3+3 model to determine maximum tolerated dose. Reports of Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) were assessed to determine the MTD to be used for the expansion cohort. DLTs were not measured in the Expansion Cohort.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: patients were assessed for response during their time on study, the longest of which was 88.1 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: To determine the number of patients reporting an objective response using RECIST v 1.1 where a Partial Response (PR) is defined as >20% decrease in tumor burden from baseline and a Complete Response (CR) is defined as complete disappearance from tumor burden from baseline. Objective Response is presented as the total # patients with PR or CR.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collections taken at Cycle 1, Week 1 for all patients at start of the infusion (pretreatment), at the end of the infusion, and at 2, 4, 24 and 48 hours after the start of the MM-121 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) evaluation was performed on plasma samples obtained weekly for the first cycle of the study and then on day 1 of each additional cycle to assess pre-treatment trough concentrations of MM-121. Non-compartmental analysis (NCA) was performed to calculate standard PK parameters, including the maximum observed concentration (Cmax). Serum levels of MM-121 were measured at a central lab using an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). Data is presented per dose level of MM-121 (12 mg/kg, 20 mg/kg, or 40/20 mg/kg).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Collections taken at Cycle 1, Week 1 for all patients at the start of the infusion (pretreatment), at the end of the infusion, and at 2, 4, 24 and 48 hours after the start of the MM-121 infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) evaluation was performed on plasma samples obtained weekly for the first cycle of the study and then on day 1 of each additional cycle to assess pre-treatment trough concentrations of MM-121. Non-compartmental analysis (NCA) was performed to calculate standard PK parameters, including the AUClast. Serum levels of MM-121 were measured at a central lab using an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). Data is presented per dose level of MM-121 (12 mg/kg, 20 mg/kg, or 40/20 mg/kg) and per study part (Part 1 or Part 2).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected for all patients pre-dose on all cycles for duration of treatment, the longest of which was 88.1 weeks, and a collection was made post-infusion in any case of infusion reaction
secondary_outcome.description: Samples were collected to determine the presence of an immunologic reaction to MM-121 (i.e. human anti-human antibodies).

arm_group.description: escalating doses of MM-121 and gemcitabine on Day 1 and Day 8 of every 3 week cycle
carboplatin at AUC 6 with escalating doses of MM-121 on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle
pemetrexed at 500 mg/m2 with escalating doses of MM-121 on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle
escalating doses of MM-121 and cabazitaxel on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle

intervention.description: MM-121 administered at 20 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by12mg/kg/week IV or 40 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by 20mg/kg/week IV
administered IV at 20 mg/m2 or 25 mg/m2
administered IV at 1000 mg/m2 or 1250 mg/m2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Advanced-stage solid tumors
- â‰¥ 18 years of age
- Adequate liver and kidney function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any other active malignancy
- No known HIV, Hepatitis C or B

measure.title: To Evaluate the Safety and Tolerability of Escalating Doses of the MM-121 Anticancer Therapies
measure.description: Safety and tolerability data presented in detail in the adverse events and serious adverse events section of the results posting

outcome.title: To Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of MM-121 in Combination With Anticancer Therapies: MM-121 Doses
outcome.description: Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose of each therapy combination was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was considered the Recommended Phase 2 Dose. Dose Levels (3 week cycles) MM-121 doses tested: 20 mg/kg IV one-time loading dose then 12 mg/kg IV QW (20/12 mg/kg); 40/20 mg/kg Gemcitabine doses tested: 1000 mg/m2 Day 1 and 8 Pemetrexed doses tested: 500 mg/m2 Day 1 Carboplatin doses tested: 5 or 6 AUC Day 1 Cabazitaxel doses tested: 20 or 25 mg/m2 Day 1 of 3
outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 88.1 weeks
outcome.population: Note: data provided below is for MM-121 doses only for the combination. Combination therapy MTDs are provided in separate endpoint measures.

group.title: MM-121 Plus Gemcitabine
group.description: escalating doses of MM-121 and gemcitabine on Day 1 and Day 8 of every 3 week cycle MM-121: MM-121 administered at 20 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by12mg/kg/week IV or 40 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by 20mg/kg/week IV Gemcitabine: administered IV at 1000 mg/m2 or 1250 mg/m2

group.description: carboplatin at AUC 6 with escalating doses of MM-121 on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle MM-121: MM-121 administered at 20 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by12mg/kg/week IV or 40 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by 20mg/kg/week IV Carboplatin: administered at AUC 6

group.title: MM-121 + Cabazitaxel
group.description: MTD of MM-121 + Cabazitaxel combination - NOTE: MTD of MM-121 for this combination provided in separate endpoint

measure.title: To Determine the Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of MM-121 in Combination With Anticancer Therapies: Cabazitaxel
measure.description: Using a 3+3 dose escalation model, the maximum tolerated dose of each therapy combination was determined by assessing dose-limiting toxicities in each cohort. If 3 patients were treated and passed the observation window, escalation to the next cohort was initiated. If a DLT was reported, 3-4 additional patients were enrolled and observed. If a DLT was observed in expanded cohort, this dose was considered to be the maximum tolerated dose. The maximum tolerated dose was defined at the cohort in which two dose-limiting toxicities were observed, or as the highest target dose tested in the absence of DLTs. The determined MTD was considered the Recommended Phase 2 Dose. Dose Levels (3 week cycles) MM-121 doses tested: 20 mg/kg IV one-time loading dose then 12 mg/kg IV QW (20/12 mg/kg); 40/20 mg/kg Cabazitaxel doses tested: 20 or 25 mg/m2 Day 1 of 3

outcome.title: To Characterize Dose-limiting Toxicities (DLTs) Associated With the Combination of MM-121 With Anticancer Therapies
outcome.description: To establish the safety of escalating doses of MM-121 administered in combination with multiple anti-cancer therapies in order to determine the recommended phase 2 dose. Dose-escalation conducted using standard 3+3 model to determine maximum tolerated dose. Reports of Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) were assessed to determine the MTD to be used for the expansion cohort. DLTs were not measured in the Expansion Cohort.
outcome.time_frame: From date of first dose to 30 days after termination, the longest 88.1 weeks

measure.description: To establish the safety of escalating doses of MM-121 administered in combination with multiple anti-cancer therapies in order to determine the recommended phase 2 dose. Dose-escalation conducted using standard 3+3 model to determine maximum tolerated dose. Reports of Dose-Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) were assessed to determine the MTD to be used for the expansion cohort. DLTs were not measured in the Expansion Cohort.

outcome.title: Objective Response Rate
outcome.description: To determine the number of patients reporting an objective response using RECIST v 1.1 where a Partial Response (PR) is defined as >20% decrease in tumor burden from baseline and a Complete Response (CR) is defined as complete disappearance from tumor burden from baseline. Objective Response is presented as the total # patients with PR or CR.
outcome.time_frame: patients were assessed for response during their time on study, the longest of which was 88.1 weeks

group.title: MM-121 Plus Gemcitabine: Cohort 1
group.description: MM-121 20 mg/kg one-time loading dose on Cycle 1, Week 1 followed 12 mg/kg IV maintenance doses weekly for 3-week cycles gemcitabine 1000 mg/m2 IV on Days 1 and 8 of each 3-week cycle

measure.title: Objective Response Rate
measure.description: To determine the number of patients reporting an objective response using RECIST v 1.1 where a Partial Response (PR) is defined as >20% decrease in tumor burden from baseline and a Complete Response (CR) is defined as complete disappearance from tumor burden from baseline. Objective Response is presented as the total # patients with PR or CR.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics
outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) evaluation was performed on plasma samples obtained weekly for the first cycle of the study and then on day 1 of each additional cycle to assess pre-treatment trough concentrations of MM-121. Non-compartmental analysis (NCA) was performed to calculate standard PK parameters, including the maximum observed concentration (Cmax). Serum levels of MM-121 were measured at a central lab using an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). Data is presented per dose level of MM-121 (12 mg/kg, 20 mg/kg, or 40/20 mg/kg).
outcome.time_frame: Collections taken at Cycle 1, Week 1 for all patients at start of the infusion (pretreatment), at the end of the infusion, and at 2, 4, 24 and 48 hours after the start of the MM-121 infusion

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics
measure.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) evaluation was performed on plasma samples obtained weekly for the first cycle of the study and then on day 1 of each additional cycle to assess pre-treatment trough concentrations of MM-121. Non-compartmental analysis (NCA) was performed to calculate standard PK parameters, including the maximum observed concentration (Cmax). Serum levels of MM-121 were measured at a central lab using an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). Data is presented per dose level of MM-121 (12 mg/kg, 20 mg/kg, or 40/20 mg/kg).

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics (AUClast)
outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) evaluation was performed on plasma samples obtained weekly for the first cycle of the study and then on day 1 of each additional cycle to assess pre-treatment trough concentrations of MM-121. Non-compartmental analysis (NCA) was performed to calculate standard PK parameters, including the AUClast. Serum levels of MM-121 were measured at a central lab using an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). Data is presented per dose level of MM-121 (12 mg/kg, 20 mg/kg, or 40/20 mg/kg) and per study part (Part 1 or Part 2).
outcome.time_frame: Collections taken at Cycle 1, Week 1 for all patients at the start of the infusion (pretreatment), at the end of the infusion, and at 2, 4, 24 and 48 hours after the start of the MM-121 infusion

measure.title: Pharmacokinetics (AUClast)
measure.description: Pharmacokinetic (PK) evaluation was performed on plasma samples obtained weekly for the first cycle of the study and then on day 1 of each additional cycle to assess pre-treatment trough concentrations of MM-121. Non-compartmental analysis (NCA) was performed to calculate standard PK parameters, including the AUClast. Serum levels of MM-121 were measured at a central lab using an enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). Data is presented per dose level of MM-121 (12 mg/kg, 20 mg/kg, or 40/20 mg/kg) and per study part (Part 1 or Part 2).

outcome.title: Immunogenicity
outcome.description: Samples were collected to determine the presence of an immunologic reaction to MM-121 (i.e. human anti-human antibodies).
outcome.time_frame: Samples were collected for all patients pre-dose on all cycles for duration of treatment, the longest of which was 88.1 weeks, and a collection was made post-infusion in any case of infusion reaction

reported_events.time_frame: AEs were collected from a patient's first dose until 30 days after treatment termination. SAEs were collected from time of informed consent until 30 days after termination. If related, events could be reported at any time after termination.
reported_events.desc: All related AEs ongoing at the time of treatment discontinuation were followed until resolution. Investigators were to report any AEs/SAEs assumed to be related any time, even if occurring more than 30 days after last dose. Though different for each patient, on average, patients could be followed for related AEs/SAEs for ~1 year after termination

group.title: MM-121 Plus Gemcitabine
group.description: escalating doses of MM-121 and gemcitabine on Day 1 and Day 8 of every 3 week cycle MM-121: MM-121 administered at 20 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by12mg/kg/week IV or 40 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by 20mg/kg/week IV

group.title: MM-121 Plus Carboplatin
group.description: carboplatin at AUC 6 with escalating doses of MM-121 on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle MM-121: MM-121 administered at 20 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by12mg/kg/week IV or 40 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by 20mg/kg/week IV Carboplatin: administered at AUC 6

group.title: MM-121 Plus Pemetrexed
group.description: pemetrexed at 500 mg/m2 with escalating doses of MM-121 on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle MM-121: MM-121 administered at 20 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by12mg/kg/week IV or 40 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by 20mg/kg/week IV Pemetrexed: administered IV at 500 mg/m2

group.title: MM-121 Plus Cabazitaxel
group.description: escalating doses of MM-121 and cabazitaxel on Day 1 of every 3 week cycle MM-121: MM-121 administered at 20 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by12mg/kg/week IV or 40 mg/kg IV loading dose followed by 20mg/kg/week IV Cabazitaxel: administered IV at 20 mg/m2 or 25 mg/m2

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
